## 

OAuth Flow

[](#oauth-flow)

  

The expected implementation of SSO with Clever is the authorization code grant type. The step-by-step flow is detailed below:

  

1.  A user initiates a login (see [Initiating Logins](/docs/oauth-implementation#initiating-logins))
2.  If the user is already authenticated with Clever, Clever will redirect the user to your applicationâ€™s **redirect URI** with an **authorization code** appended. If the user is not yet authenticated with Clever, they will be asked to provide their Clever credentials before being redirected.
3.  Your application will POST the **authorization code** back to Cleverâ€™s token endpoint with the appropriate credentials. See [our Postman Collection](https://www.postman.com/clever-pe/developer-collections/request/iouuo4x/auth-grant-flow-tokens) for an example.
    1.  You can also test it out from your terminal using our guide [here](/docs/getting-started-with-clever-sso).
4.  Clever responds with an **access token** in order to provide your application access to the end-userâ€™s **protected resource**.
5.  The **access token** can then be used at [https://api.clever.com/v3.0/me](https://api.clever.com/v3.0/me) to grab the **resource ownerâ€™s** Clever ID.

> ## ðŸš§
> 
> /me Endpoint Version
> 
> Be sure to specify a version in your /me endpoint call. This will ensure you receive the correct Clever ID for a user given the API version being used in other API calls.

6.  Using the **access token** and the **resource ownerâ€™s Clever ID**, your application can then make a call to [https://api.clever.com/v3.0/users/{id}](https://api.clever.com/v3.0/users/%7Bid%7D) to access additional information that can be used to authenticate a user. See [our Postman collection](https://www.postman.com/clever-pe/developer-collections/request/gbicgr1/users-id) for an example.

  

## 

OIDC Flow

[](#oidc-flow)

  

The OIDC flow is similar to the basic OAuth 2.0 flow, but is better suited for authentication and is meant to be more secure.

  

Clever's OIDC **discovery endpoint** can be found here: [<https://clever.com/.well-known/openid-configuration>](https://clever.com/.well-known/openid-configuration)

  

The flow is described below:

  

1.  A user initiates a login (see [Initiating Logins](/docs/oauth-implementation#initiating-logins))
2.  If the user is already authenticated with Clever, Clever will redirect the user to your applicationâ€™s **redirect URI** with an **authorization code** appended. If the user is not yet authenticated with Clever, they will be asked to provide their Clever credentials before being redirected.
3.  Your application will POST the **authorization code** back to Cleverâ€™s token endpoint with the appropriate credentials. See ([our Postman collection](https://www.postman.com/clever-pe/developer-collections/request/iouuo4x/auth-grant-flow-tokens)) for an example.
4.  Clever responds with an **identity token** that can be decoded and used to identify the resource owner (See [OAuth/OIDC Data Access](/docs/overview#oauthoidc-data-access) above).
